page.title: 08East Shoreham
page.content: The Norfolk Bridge that crosses the River Adur is today having a lot of work done as it is too narrow for big lorries. It is only 18 feet wide and two lorries find it hard to pass each other;this causes long traffic jams. The bridge is 61O feet long. The arches were built in 1923,now they are pulling them down. It will cost Â£2,5OO,OOO to build a steel frame underneath a concrete deck and widen it to 24 feet. The bridge will have safety railings along each side. The bridge used to be a toll bridge; one of the old toll houses is still there as a private home. In 1927 the toll was stopped. The pub near the bridge, the King's Head,is being pulled down to make the road wider and allow for redevelopment.
